author: Ruaridh
authorRole: a service user
title: Very satisfied with Borders Podiatry service
body: Due to a hip problem I am unable to cut my toe Nails nails, so I accessed NHS Borders Podiatry and I am very satisfied.

readBy.name: NHS Borders

author: Tix30
authorRole: a service user
title: Infertility
body: Absolute lack of basic care and compassionate, horrific experience! Treating people like human beings not like an inconvenience should be the first lesson in the so called caring profession surely.

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: yellowfd65
authorRole: the patient
title: Family Planning
body:
I went to get some more of my pill. The lady that dealt with me was absolutely lovely, very kind and friendly.  Most importantly she was very informative. 
My appointment was right on time, as it has been the past few times I've been here which is great. 
Only negative is that I was given out of date condoms.

readBy.name: Midlands Partnership NHS Foundation Trust

author: RHooks
authorRole: a parent/guardian
title: Health Care Visitor
body: We have been visited by our Health Visitor monthly for the past few months.  Each time she has arrived she has been friendly and supportive.  She quickly helped us deal with any anxieties we had as first time parents.  She has given relevant and useful advice on how to support our baby never making us feel stupid.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: aoiy23
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I really enjoy when staff do the activities with us
body:
The staff have been very helpful and informative at all times, whenever I am in need of something they are there to help me with it. I have always felt in comfortable hands of the team to provide brilliant care to me.  
I have Margaret and I think her name is Aimee. They are wonderful. Everyone is so compassionate and helpful. They have cared for me so well what I like about the care is that they are patient and kind to all of us.  
I really like when we participate in activates its my favourite time of the day when we do these I tend to go over and play cards. I really enjoy when staff do the activities with us as they can be so funny at times when doing them. I can't say enough good things about them all.  
I don’t really enjoy the cups of tea to much as they can be quite water but all the other meals have been quite enjoyable.  
Thank you very much for the care that has been provided to me

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

links.id: very well looked after and cared for

author: Elle2
authorRole: a friend
title: Car park Cross house hospital Kilmarnock
body:
Brought child to a and e due to a burn. As very urgent we were in a stressed and distressed state.  
I have a blue badge, dropped others at door and had to park in nearest space. Which in itself is a significant distance for me to walk As I was get out car I fell , and appears blue badge fell from usual place.  
Still visible ,but due to fall, that impaired my already reduced ability to bend plus was very conscious that child's mum was  
Very upset ,as was child. So rushed in.  
Parking ticket. Only description "not in prescribed manner".  
What does that mean?.  
That blue badge needs to be scrutinized so it's within a prescribed area?.  
Are people expected to injure themselves ?  
We were in an urgent situation  
I have a valid blue badge,  
The 3rd party the NHS use refused to communicate with me  
The only correspondence sent to someone who was out the country.

readBy.name: NHS Ayrshire & Arran

author: aoiy23
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I am amazed at how quickly we had been treated
body:
My daughter has been brought into the minor injuries unit this afternoon as I got a call from one of the summer camp members this morning to say she had fallen and hurt her wrist.  
I was able to ring into the minor injuries outpatient department and was told to bring my daughter into the unit 2 hours later. I am delighted that they were able to see her today, they have been very accommodating.  
15 minutes after our appointment time was due my daughter had been examined by the nurse practitioner, we were then told that she was going to have an x-ray. This is my daughter's first time getting an x-ray and she was a bit scared but the radiographer was very good and reassuring.  
An hour later my daughter has now been diagnosed with a fracture and we are leaving with a splint in situ and lots of information for what to do over the next 4-6 weeks.  
I am amazed at how quickly we had been treated and the professionalism and competence demonstrated by all the staff involved. Thank you all.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: HanLan
authorRole: a service user
title: Post op wound and catheter care
body: Charlie the nurse came to the house around 9am to see me for removal of clips and a TWOC.  She introduced herself and prepared well for the tasks.  She reassured me, took her time and listened to my questions offering advice about pain relief, urinary care and wound care.  I was very happy with her care and would gladly see her again.

readBy.name: Nottinghamshire Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: aoiy23
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff have been just amazing and without exception
body:
I have been on this ward for a long time, and I have been really enjoying my time here. I have gotten to know a lot of knew people and we all get along really well.  
The staff have been just amazing and without exception, they go over and above anything I expected. Sometimes I feel sorry for them as they work so hard for us and I would just like them to take a wee tea break from time to time to relax themselves.  
The nursing staff and health care assistants are really extraordinary and work so hard, and under such pressure. I never heard any of them complain, and they always come over to me very cheerfully and quickly.  
I know at times I can’t be the easiest of patients to deal with but they all treat me as if I am the most important person in the world. Each and every member of staff I have met is a complete credit to the NHS and I will always be grateful to them for helping me.  
Thank you to all the staff members on the Gillis Ward.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: aquariuswm75
authorRole: a service user
title: I have been kept in the dark about my own health
body:
I’ve been in the system since 14. I’ve seen NHS professionals from CAMHS to adult services. I’ve been on waiting lists for extremely extended periods of time, had calls to say my data has been lost, told I am being referred and then realising months later that no action has been taken.  
I had to go private to get help, I’m now in a lot of debt, can’t afford the medication, and STILL have not received help after a shared care protocol was submitted.  
I feel I have been kept in the dark about my own health. Time lines are not given, solutions are not provided. My work is being compromised and my life quality has plummeted in recent years.  
The most painful part is I found something that works, and now cannot afford the care. The deterioration is intense and impacts relationships, physical health and professional life. Still no action is taken.

readBy.name: East London NHS Foundation Trust
City & Hackney GP Confederation
The Hoxton Surgery

author: Cucfm78
authorRole: a relative
title: Hopefully we can stop this happening to someone else
body:
My Cousin who has now died, was I feel very poorly treated regarding his terminal cancer care.  
He was discharged from the respiratory ward at Royal Derby Hospital, but we are not sure really if he discharged himself or not. He could be quite abusive to staff and family, but we put this down to anxiety about the fact that he may die. He had terminal lung cancer.  
He came home with no care plan.  
I rang 111 as I did not feel he should have been allowed home without some type of care package.  
I was told they can not force care!  
A district nurse arrived to sort out his bed sores, and when I spoke of my concerns they arranged private carers to come in, and they were marvellous. However, I still believe my cousin should have had the best end-of-life care. He was incontinent and he also had a bad sore on his foot, which turned to gangrene. His neighbour used to clean him up. He could be very abusive as I have said before, but he was very poorly.  
He phoned for an ambulance and was taken to QMC Notts as he refused to go to the Derby Royal. He was put on oxygen, and passed away that night.  
I feel he could have had much better end-of-life care and it may just be coinciding, but he received none. I appreciate the NHS are experiencing difficult times, but surely care comes first.  
I feel very sad that my cousin had to die in these circumstances, and now he has gone, not much we can do about it. However, hopefully we can stop this happening to someone else.  
Feeling very upset about it all.

readBy.name: Nottingham University Hospitals NHS Trust
DHU Healthcare CIC
Derbyshire Community Health Services NHS Foundation Trust

author: Royal Blue
authorRole: the patient
title: Appalled by what I heard
body:
I attended this GP surgery for an appointment with the nurse. While waiting in the reception area I was absolutely appalled by what I could hear in the waiting room, and how patient confidentiality was breached in many ways.  
While sitting waiting, a member of staff was calling patients in. They didn't close the door of the room and I could see straight in but also hear the conversations they were having about medical conditions. What happened to privacy?  
Also a GP was doing a telephone consultation with a patient on the phone and had their door open with the patient on loud speaker. I heard the whole call, & really felt for the patient as they would never know that not just me but others in reception could hear everything.  
I found it outrageous. I told the receptionist but they said there was nothing they could do. Really? Maybe use a headphone and close the door, and other staff close the door too.  
Surely this is a breach of data protection. The patient answered a number of security questions at the start of that call and gave personal details. I would have been fuming if that was me on the end of the phone  
Surely as you just don't offer GP face to face appointments anymore, and only do telephone, confidentiality is still key?  
I feel this really needs looking into.

author: Belfast eye
authorRole: a service user
title: Accessing blood test results
body:
I suffer from a rare condition and from time to time I'll have blood tests to aid me in self care.  
I attended the treatment room at Grove medical practice, Belfast and the nurse was excellent in dealing with me.  
I attended the practice to retrieve my blood results and in this I hit a brick wall, as the staff at reception wouldn't give me my blood results. I asked for the doctor to phone me so I could discuss my blood test and was told that I couldn't have a phone appointment with the doctor as they were for emergencies only, so I asked to speak to the practice manager and was told that I couldn't speak to the practice manager either so I finally asked for a complaints form.  
I've never been treated so badly the customer care was sadly missing on this occasion. The staff member also wasn't wearing an identification name badge, those NHS staff who deal with the public must wear a name badge.  
Later in the morning someone from practice management phoned me, but that didn't alleviate going through such a poor experience.  
I feel so annoyed, angry and frustrated that I couldn't get my blood results when I requested them, at that no one sought assistance from other members of staff who were able to give me my results if they hadn't been able to do so! If staff are not trained they should have someone who they can call upon.

author: Patsyxxx
authorRole: a carer
title: Making appointment with call centre
body: I found call center staff very helpful but unfotunately they couldn't put me through to who I wished to speak to. Secondly if you received a miss call from Barton House its unable to trace from whom its from. The waiting time can extremely long by phone if not contacting via online.

readBy.name: Barton House Group Practice
City & Hackney GP Confederation

author: aoiy23
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff have been great at trying their best to reassure me
body:
I have come into Craigavon Area Hospital through the emergency department. When I first came in it wasn’t too busy as there were only a couple, however that soon changed as one after another just flooded in.  
We watched the staff coping with it all and to be honest they handled it all so professionally it must have been hard work. There was a point where it did become overcrowded and felt as if everyone was on top of each other it was that busy.  
Now that they have moved up to 4 South I am much better and feel lot more comfortable with it being less crowded than ED. I am a nervous wreck being in hospital and the staff have been great at trying their best to reassure me and help me through my recovery.  
They have been keeping up the high standards of care in these conditions, also cleanliness has been good as everything seems to be sanitized repeatedly which is good to see. The food so far has been okay I haven’t received that many meals as I have only came in last night but all so far is good.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: snowxx48
authorRole: the patient
title: Coil check
body: I rang the sexual health clinic at Tamworth, Sir Robert Peel, where I spoke to a nurse called Beth. She was very helpful, empathetic and caring over the phone, even calling me back later on the same day to check how I was. Beth managed to see me the following day in clinic, where she checked my coil for me. She made me feel at ease and calm. She was professional, understanding and very helpful. She’s a credit to her area and the NHS.

readBy.name: Midlands Partnership NHS Foundation Trust

author: November 68
authorRole: the patient
title: Full knee operation
body: I went to Stracathro Hospital for a full knee replacement, I was in the surgical ward and have nothing but praise for all the staff on the ward, they couldn't have done enough for you and looked after your every need, I cannot thank them enough and even though I was in for a serious operation had a great time and a good laugh, keep up the great work your doing and thank you very much,

readBy.name: NHS Tayside

author: aquilanp95
authorRole: the patient
title: Removal of Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the skin
body:
Attended Forth Valley Royal Hospital, Larbert, for the above minor operation, on left posterior shoulder. David, who carried out the procedure, explained every stage in great detail, and was ably assisted by Laura and Maureen.  
They were very attentive and friendly. I felt completely relaxed and confident, as we chatted the whole time.

readBy.name: Scottish Government
NHS Forth Valley

author: aoiy23
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: One of the best decisions I have ever made.
body:
I arrived into Sliverwood a few weeks ago and I have to say even though I was reluctant in coming in here, it was one of the best decisions I have ever made.  
My niece was very good as she was able to help me with my admissions,  
When I came in I felt welcomed by the staff, I got the sense that actually it does feel quite comfortable here. I like how the ward is quite modern as it brings more of a homely vibe to it.  
The cleanliness of the ward is very good the cleaners are always in and out of my room as the beds are changed daily and toilets are always kept at a high standard of cleanliness.  
The meals I have been receiving have been very good can’t complain about it as it’s like something you would be served at a hotel, brilliant!  
Staff are always catering for our needs if we would like help with something they are there to help us.  
I do feel comfortable around staff and they always tells us that they are always up for a chat which in my opinion makes me feel supported by them.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: aoiy23
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The team members are very good at listening
body: My time in Gillis has been very good due to the staff making it very enjoyable. They are just brilliant as they always come over to see me and check in on me. They have been very friendly, kind, understanding and very supportive. They had that special calming effect, which makes it easier to talk to them. I feel very happy with the staff on the ward. I wouldn’t ask for any other team to look after me as I just want this one. I cannot thank them all enough. The cleanliness of the ward is very good they are always going about either brushing or moping the floors. The food has also been very good - I enjoy the Shepard’s pie with the chocolate pudding and custard for dessert. The team members are very good at listening to me and with their support, they help me with my everyday activities. I cannot think of any way that the team can improve, they all are so helpful. Not one of the team members have ever looked down at me and this made me feel like I was someone and I am important. I feel like they have been my friends for years. Please keep up the good work.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Holidayvisit
authorRole: a parent/guardian
title: Holiday visit to Minor Injury’s at Ards Community Hospital
body:
My daughter injured her leg whilst ice skating. I called the Minor Injury Unit at Ards Community Hospital initially for some advice on where to take my daughter.  
The receptionist on the telephone was brilliant, calm, kind and caring, the medical team also the same whilst I explained what had happened. They gave me an appointment , and advised I would need change for the parking metres.  
When we arrived at the unit , the service was smooth , efficient and friendly. emergency nurse practitioner (Liesal) was brilliant , she explained her thoughts to myself, husband and my daughter so she could understand, quick x ray and identified a fracture at the ankle.  
As we were here on holiday she took time to ask our plans to then take the best course of action and what we should do when returning home.  
The whole process from our appointment to leaving was 1 hour which is amazing.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: pilingsmc33
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: You can’t improve perfection
body:
I came in in the early hours of yesterday morning. I came up to ED before being moved up to male medical.  
I was seen very quickly in ED. The doctors in ED were very thorough. They ran plenty of tests, scans and bloods. The doctors looking after me have been consulting with specialists in Craigavon Area Hospital. Doctor Shaw and Doctor Farah have been brilliant. They are such lovely people. Very caring and extremely helpful.  
The ward is brilliant, the bed is comfortable and it’s good and clean.  
There is nothing to fault at all. You can’t improve perfection.  
Everything has been brilliant.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Tersg66
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I am delighted with everything
body:
I have been in hospital a few days now. I have been in male medical and the staff are fantastic. I couldn’t fault anyone up here. The doctors, the nurses, the cleaners. Everyone is brilliant. They have all made my stay fantastic. It’s like a hotel stay.  
The ward is very good. I asked the cleaner if she would clean round the bottom of the trolley for me and she came straight away and cleaned it.  
The food is brilliant. The menu can maybe be a bit repetitive but the food is always good.  
I don’t think there is anything to complain about at all. I haven’t a bad word to say about my experience at all. I am delighted with everything.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a service user
title: Brilliant ward
body:
The Ramone 3 ward is brilliant. I feel so comfortable here as I have so much space and the nurses treat me well.  
Everything's clean and the facilities are all good, nothing on the ward could be improved, its been perfect for me.  
The staff have kept me updated and have been a great company, they would never pass without seeing how you are, which is nice of them.  
The food's okay, my appetite at the start put me off a bit but the soup and ice cream has been good.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: intensitypm38
authorRole: the patient
title: Excellent care and attention shown throughout.
body:
Had appointment made for what I thought was a Mammogram, by my GP Dr Flowers.  
I attended and found it was complete Breast check up.  
Consultation with a Doctor, a Mammogram, an Ultrasound, and final consultation with the Doctor.  
Happily everything was fine.  
I just wanted to commend all of the nurses, clinicians, doctors for the excellent care and attention shown throughout the appointment.

readBy.name: NHS Borders

author: aoiy23
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I have only recently been admitted on to this ward
body: I have only recently been admitted on to this ward ( Sliverwood Unit) and so far it has been okay. There are times where the Ward can become very loud and hectic which is sort of annoying but I know this is not the staffs fault and this can’t be avoided. It has been hard for me to adjust to being in this new environment away from home but staff have been working alongside me and helping me. Can’t fault the staff in any way we do have our up and downs days but I always know that I can go to them if I am in need of something. I do feel that staff are caring for me very well, and before I came in I did have a few questions and they were all answered. I am bi polar, and can become quite manic at the times but fortunately the staff are very good at what they do and how to help me as they are experienced at dealing with people in my state of health.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I cannot fault it
body:
Outpatients is a great department. The department is well kept and everything is in order. I have never had to wait too long on my appointment  
The staff are amazing. They do their best and really are invested in how you are doing. They are very friendly and I am not afraid to ask them any questions if I have any.  
Outpatients is a clean department- I cannot fault it.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Tersg66
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff are angels without wings
body:
I came in to the hospital a week ago today. I came up to ED and was then moved up to male medical. I have been so well looked after. They are angels without wings up here. They are more than helpful. Every single one of the staff on this ward have been wonderful.  
I have been in and out of hospital for a while now but this is my first time staying in Daisy Hill and it really has been brilliant. I am usually in Craigavon. But my stay in Daisy Hill has been brilliant.  
The doctors are round every morning. They are very thorough. If I don’t understand what they are saying, they really take the time to explain it better to me.  
I don’t have great taste buds since I got chemotherapy so I don’t really taste the food, but it’s always warm and there is plenty on the plate which is great.  
I don’t know how anyone can fault the staff in Daisy Hill. I think they are amazing!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: aoiy23
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I am happy to be on this ward (4 North)
body:
I am happy to be on this ward (4 North) as the nurses are so caring and pleasant towards you. One of the HCA on this ward Anna is brilliant, she is really amazing at what she does as she has such a friendly and kind personality. She has been with me ever since I came on this ward, she helps me with everything and when helping me stand up she is always careful which I like as she know to be patient with me as I didn’t liked to be rushed. She always asked about me and listens to my stories, even though they may be boring she always listens!  
But not only Anna everyone on this ward have been very good you can see that they all work very well together because they are treating each other with care. I also like how this ward is quite quiet compared to other areas I have been in. The doctors are great too and I have great trust in them as you can tell they know what they are doing. We may not see them as much as the nurses now but understandably so.  
The food has been very nice and the cleaning staff clearly work so hard and keep the ward in great condition. This makes me feel better in hospital knowing you are on a clean ward when you are trying to get better to go home. Overall I am very happy with my care so far here.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The care that I have been getting in the hospital has so far been pretty good
body: The care that I have been getting in the hospital has so far been pretty good so far. The staff that I have looking after me have all been really lovely all of them have been really quite nice. They take the time to answer my questions and have been brilliant communicating with me as I can understand anything they say even with my treatment plan which can be complex. I am happy with the care I have gotten and want to thank the staff

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: ClaraMcg123
authorRole: a parent/guardian
title: Podiatry at Motherwell Health Centre
body: My daughter received excellent care from the podiatry team at Motherwell Health Centre. She was seen by Kim and Anthony who took time to allay her fears, explain the procedure and take things at her pace. They were so thoughtful and caring. We really appreciated their care today.

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: Katee95
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Bubbly and uplifting staff
body:
My child was diagnosed with a long term illness 2 months ago and we have been in and out Blossom since due to complications.  
The bubbly and uplifting staff have been just wonderful and made the journey a lot easier. From the outset, we have been informed of any decision/ treatment/ care plan etc. So always feel involved and informed.  
Thank you to everyone for the extensive care in Blossom.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Tersg66
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: They tell me every day what they are doing next and why.
body:
My stay in Male medical has been brilliant. The staff are very helpful and I am very well looked after. Everyone is lovely. The doctors are excellent. They tell me every day what they are doing next and why.  
I wouldn’t be too impressed with the food. I generally am quite picky but everyone’s taste is different.  
The ward is clean, Daisy hill has always been a very clean and well-presented hospital.  
I am very happy with everything. The care has been excellent. My daughter is actually a nurse in Australia so I know how hard they work. My only suggestion would be that the nurses deserve a lot better pay for the work they do.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: mayqp75
authorRole: a service user
title: Giving birth
body:
I was lucky enough to have a home birth. I gave birth to my daughter with the great support of the community midwives, who were amazing, supportive, understanding and I couldnt have asked for better professionals. I was lucky that my midwife, Lyndsay H was there with me to support me with Kiki. Lyndsay, was great all throughout my pregnancy, reassuring me and as a first time mom I needed a fair bit of reassurance. She also, advocated for me to have a home birth as the service was suspended around the time I was due, and for that I am forever grateful to both Lyndsay and Kiki.  
Due to a rupture I ended up in hospital and was looked after in the labour ward, the midwife was absolutely amazing in particular to my husband when I was away in theater. The theater staff was also amazing.  
Then I was also looked after by Amy in ward 16, Amy was also amazing, she reassured me and helped me get home promptly and supported me when I needed it.  
Once home the community midwives came to see me regularly, offered a great support and were just amazing. I feel so lucky to have had such great professionals by my family's side.  
Now I am been supported by the great  
Health Visitor Beauty, who is very knowledgable, approachable and just amazing with my baby, husband and I.  
Overall, everyone who I came across from NHS Borders was and is absolutely amazing and provided an outstanding care. Well done everyone, I am so grateful and amazed by your care.

readBy.name: NHS Borders

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: PAW staff are great with children
body:
PAW is great, like amazing. It is brilliant for children with all the colours and designs on the walls. My daughter calmed down so quickly in here. The appointment was really quick since it was just a check up.  
The staff are amazing. Totally fantastic. They must love their jobs and they are brilliant at it, they know everything and tell me everything I need to know.  
PAW staff are great with children.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Really couldn't ask for a better group of staff
body: I am really happy with the care that I have been getting so far as I honestly think that it has been brilliant since I got admitted just a few days ago. I really couldn't ask for a better group of staff looking after me as they have all been brilliant and are all very kind. I also appreciate the time they take to communicate with me and make sure that i understand everything. The foods been okay and my only criticism is the lack of variety after a few days

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: yellowte73
authorRole: a parent/guardian
title: Admission to Paul ward in Royal hospital for sick children
body:
My 4 year old son sustained a broken arm and we were transferred to RHBSC from Daisy hill for ongoing care because of his age.  
Fortunately he did not require surgery and we only had one night in hospital. We received excellent care on Paul ward. The communication from everyone was exemplary and I felt very reassured and listened to during what was a stressful time. I also want to mention the radiographer Eoin who we seen after his arm was recast. He was so patient and gentle with my son to ensure good quality images were taken.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: very happy with the care so far and cant complain at all
body: The care that I have gotten since i was admitted has been pretty good so far don't really see any reason to complain about it. The staff have treated me pretty good cant really make any comments on them as they have been very nice and treated me pretty well so far. They have all been great in making sure that I understand them and allowing me to ask any questions. I have been very happy with the care so far and cant complain at all

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: T1973
authorRole: the patient
title: Wonderful team!!
body: I’d just like to recognise some of the brilliant care I have been receiving post an ankle surgery.The surgery itself was completed by Dr Gibson. The surgery ended up being a little more complicated than I expected and I’d like to thank Mr Gibson for his determination, professionalism and surgical skill in resolving the problem. I’d highly recommend him to anyone in need of help.My recovery has now been managed by the wonderful Nursing Staff of fracture clinic 3 at Alnagelvin.This team has been providing excellent wound management for me and have made my recovery much easier than I expected.The courteous, down to earth, good humoured feeling within the clinic put me very much at ease from the beginning and the nursing staff then back that up with incredible levels of attention to detail and wound treatment excellence.Once I realised this team had my back with recovery, well I’ve been able to relax. (That is massive not only for the physical side but also the mental side of recovery).I’ve now been treated by a few different pairs of the staff and it's been very obvious of how great a team they are. They easily bounce opinions off each other to ensure optimum treatment and have gained my total trust.I consider myself very lucky to have been treated by this team and humbly thank them for everything they have done.Eleven outta Ten !!Kind regards

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: Fyvie lad 93
authorRole: the patient
title: Aberdeen Royal Infirmary rheumatology department
body: I thought it was a rather speedy service to be honest especially for something that wasn’t down as urgent. Very friendly reception staff and nurses was friendly aswell. Doctor who I seen was very helpful and made me feel listened to after having a bad experience with that department in past. Was kept in the loop inbetween appointments and the scan was done fairly quick considering long waiting lists. Again was kept in loop and offered a follow up appointment in a short time. Dr Robertson was very helpful again and I felt that appointment was of more help than in the past as they seemed to do more than any other time and i definitely felt like they were more understanding and more helpful

readBy.name: NHS Grampian
Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Outpatient staff know all
body:
Outpatient is great. The department is clean and neat every time I have been here. It is also quite easy to find following the directions on the wall, or you can ask reception.  
The staff are great. I really like them all since they are so friendly. They are a great help since they know most if it not all about your condition.  
Outpatient staff know all.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff have been really lovely
body: I have been pretty happy with the care that I have been getting and i think its been pretty good so far really don't have a bad word to say about everything. The staff have been really lovely like all of them have all been really nice i couldn't say a bad word about a single one of them. The staff are great though and have taking the time to explain everything to me very well in a way I understands which I appreciate a lot.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I really dont think that i could say a bad word about the care taht they have given me
body: I would class the care that I have been getting in the hospital as very good at least from what I have seen. The staff have all been absolutely lovely i really don't think that i could say a bad word about the care that they have given me so far or them for that matter. I have found i can understand most of them and if i don't there are more than enough of them happy to explain anything with my care which is great and i really appreciate that.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a service user
title: Lovely experience
body:
Every time I am in the Mandeville it's always a lovely experience. The staff are always so kind and friendly. I haven't been coming to the unit for very long but I haven't had any issues so far, everyone's been fantastic.  
The communication and facilities are top class.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Outpatients staff are fabulous
body:
Outpatients is a great department. This is only my second time here but so far so good. I am coming since my hearing is not the best and they have helped me through it.  
Staff all know what they are doing and have great knowledge of their jobs. They are just the best people and are people you can rely on.  
Outpatients staff are fabulous.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: hippoqm45
authorRole: a relative
title: Ward 3 staff, Queen Margaret Hospital
body:
One of my parents was given a side room in Ward 3 through the determination of the palliative care team for end of life care. As a family, we cannot express our thanks enough to the amazing staff there. Every member of staff checked we were OK, checked on my parent and allowed them to die with the dignity that they had wanted to.  
We were touched and amazed at their thoughtfulness, kindness and caring at such an awful time. Special mention to Taylor for the final stages of my parents life.  
The fact that the hospice in QMH has been closed is beyond disgraceful yet the staff in Ward 3 provided care beyond anything we could have hoped for.

readBy.name: Scottish Government
NHS Fife

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I am pleased with my care
body: The care that I have been getting since I was admitted into the ramone has been pretty decent and I really don't think that i could ask for a better level of care since i came into ramone. The staff up here have all been really lovely they have all done a very decent job and I really couldn't ask for a better level of care. The staff all take the time to explain everything great and have answered my questions very well. I am pleased with my care

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: guideqn75
authorRole: a parent/guardian
title: Speech therapy for my son
body: My 2 year old son had been referred last year after a community paediatric referral had been rejected. From the minute we received our triage call, the entire speech therapy team we have came into contact with have been brilliant. From our first appointment, Joanna re-referred my son to paeds, as she immediately saw the traits I had been concerned about. It was great that someone was finally listening. We’ve had sessions with Joanna , Laura and now Kevina and each of the girls have been brilliant with my son. We had our last appointment before our break today and Kevina is sending further referrals and chasing up other things for us. It is great to have a team of great advocates for my son alongside ourselves. Thank you girls, it is much appreciated, you are not only great with my son but a great ear for a worried mammy as well 😊 !

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Outpatients staff give you great support if you need it
body:
Outpatients is a fantastic department there is no hassle in coming in here apart from the parking, but that cannot be helped.  
The staff are great, I cannot praise them enough. They really are such a good team. It does not matter who you get they are all fantastic. They are a shoulder there if you need it.  
Outpatients staff give you great support if you need it.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Outpatients staff are great at explaining everything
body:
Outpatients is an appointment I do not mind coming to. It is usually just a quick checkup and I am in and out. The place is always clean and tidy.  
The staff are great I really have to say. The explain everything to me in a way I understand and, they always make sure ay questions are answered that you may have.  
Outpatients staff are great at explaining everything.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: really couldn't say a bad word about any of them
body: I think the care has been very good so far and I really think that i have been treated pretty well since i got admitted into the hospital really cant complain so far. The staff have all been very nice and do a brilliant job like I really couldn't say a bad word about any of them. There all lovely and I have found them very easy to understand as the way the communicate is so clear and so well aimed at me

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Finley
authorRole: the patient
title: Health visitors
body:
Zoe and Eileen have been my health visitors. Both have been absolutely wonderful and really made me feel cared for and like I’ve had firm professional support in place should I need it.  
Zoe visited first, she was warm and an excellent source of knowledge and signposted me to lots of training courses and videos to support me on my pregnancy journey. Extremely personable, non-judgemental and professional, she was a pleasure to have in my home.  
Eileen visited next and was an absolute wealth of experience and knowledge in talking myself and my partner through what may happen during labour-insightful, supported my understanding and made me confident that I could cope with labour through her honest account of the science bits and the possible variations that could happen-she eased my anxiety no end! My baby came a month early, a couple of days before I was due to see Eileen again and I received a wonderful message from her whilst in hospital congratulating me on the birth of my baby boy. She made me feel very special and like she genuinely cared about supporting me to be the best that I could be. Zoe revisited us at 4months post birth and again was warm, friendly yet professional in her visit. She reassured me that I was doing a good job, reminded me to be kind to myself on the days things are trickier and keep the 3 Cs in mind. She listened to how I was doing as a new mum, weighed my baby, plotted his growth and talked me through what that meant and celebrated with me the milestones reached so far. She once again signposted me to more information that was specific to my circumstances and sent me a follow up email with links to websites etc to support me -with baby brain going on it was really helpful to receive the email later the same day and again, made me feel well supported and cared for.Between these two amazing ladies, I could not have felt more supported during my pregnancy and as a new mum. They have also reassured me that this is a service that I can access should I feel I need it in the future-nothing was too much hassle for these ladies and I can’t thank them enough for the fabulous job they do.

readBy.name: Stockport NHS Foundation Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I havent had any issues since i came in here
body: I have been quite pleased with the care that I have been getting in 4 south. The treatment given to me by the staff has been at a brilliant level as they are all so kind and have taken to the time to get me anything that I need. Having them there has made the care so good as I know there always on hand to explain anything and are doing their best to get me discharged. I haven't had any issues since I came in here.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a service user
title: Good feedback from staff
body:
I arrived to hospital via emergency department, the staff in ED were helpful and made me feel comfortable as I waited for a bed.  
Everything on the ward has been fine, the staff are all brilliant I'm happy with the care received, whenever I need help with something they have been there to give me a hand.  
The communication with nurses and doctors is good, they give me good feedback and have provided with as much information as possible.  
The foods not the best, it could be improved as it doesn't seem that good for you.  
The cleanliness is 100% the ward is spotless and if I need anything changed like my bed sheets the staff always get it done as quick as possible.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Katee95
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Amazing staff in neonatal
body: Thank you to all the brilliant staff who have cared for my baby in the neonatal unit. It has undoubtedly been one of the toughest things I have ever had to go through, however the staff have been such a brilliant support network. Without the care of those in neonatal my baby mightn’t be here today and I am so grateful for that. The neonatal ward is brilliant and still provides an element of privacy alongside having the support. The only minor issue I would have is that the food for the mums often comes at a time where I may be breastfeeding or busy with the baby so I can’t avail of it… some sort of flexibility with time or a voucher may be more beneficial. Otherwise, the attention to detail and care is unmatched. Thank you to everyone in neonatal

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Katee95
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Busy A+E but great care
body: I arrived into A+E Friday night with my daughter who had severe stomach pains as our GP said to go if they persist. When we eventually got into blossom, I was so impressed to see the amazing facilities and the privacy that the individual rooms provide. The rooms are so modern and spacious and it's a luxury to have a bed in the room also for me. I couldn't speak highly enough of each and every staff member and want to thank everyone in Paediatrics. The only issue I would have is the long wait in A+E, it took hours, however I appreciate how overworked and understaffed the system is.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Morton20
authorRole: the patient
title: Fybriod Resection and Polyp removal
body:
I was admitted and the care I received was exemplary. The nurses took their time to go through all the questions and explained any concerns I had. The Surgeon was excellent and she took the time to explain the procedure, what they planned to do. She made me feel at ease.  
The anaesthetist and the anaesthetic nurse were also brilliant when I went into the anaesthetic room, as I was very anxious. They reassured me that I would be fine and that they would look after me all the way through the procedure.  
I have great admiration for the work they done, be it my operation was minor, they are a credit to the NHS.

readBy.name: NHS Tayside

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: This service has really gave me a boost in confidence
body:
This service has really gave me a boost in confidence, I'm very grateful for all the staff have done.  
All staff I have come across in the clinic have been very friendly and are easy to talk to. I haven't had any issues. My appointments are always arranged well and changing them to suit usually isn't any bother, if I have any questions I can just phone up and I will get talking to someone straight away.  
Being able to communicate with the staff so well is great as there is never any confusion and it has made my process at dermatology a lot smoother.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: They're all very kind and easy to understand.
body:
The care that I have been getting since I came into the hospital has honestly been brilliant so far and I really cant complain about a thing since I came into the hospital.  
The staff that I have had looking after me up here on the ward have honestly been great like I really couldn't say a bad word about any of them no matter the role. They're all very kind and easy to understand.  
The food's been alright like I don't mind it at all. I haven't an issue since I came into the hospital.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Aberm84
authorRole: a service user
title: Inverurie Maternity Unit
body: The most wonderful experience of post-natal care from Inverurie Maternity Unit led by midwifes after the birth of my baby. My baby struggled with latching so the midwifes brought me in to the facility to establish feeding. They were so kind, caring and helpful. I had my own comfortable room with en-suite and what often felt like one-to-one care. What an excellent facility with brilliant staff! Recommend people make the most of it.

readBy.name: NHS Grampian
Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership

author: Katee95
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Uncertainty with operation
body: I have been suffering with a severe pain across my stomach which was triggered by certain foods, it was discovered to be gallstones so I was brought into hospital the other day night. The staff are generally excellent and approachable. I would definitely say that they are overworked and understaffed and as a result, I have noticed that they complete the tasks at haste. What I have an issue with is that I am not kept in the loop at all times as to what is going on. For example, at no point did anyone mention my operation throughout the day… leaving me unsettled. Hopefully I will receive my operation ASAP with no delays or complications.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: They take a lot of time to make sure I am okay
body:
I am honestly happy enough with the care so far it has been pretty good like. I haven't had any problem since I got into here.  
The staff have all been very nice like no matter what they do whether it be the physios, domestics doctors any of them that I speak to have all been very nice and take a lot of time to make sure that I am okay and haven't any issues.  
The foods actually pretty good which I like.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: ElaineLD
authorRole: a relative
title: Patient Transfer
body:
Yesterday, my Mum was eventually discharged from Ward 15, Hairmyres Hospital, after being in for 9 weeks.  
As already reported, Mum's Care was exceptional, just a shame about her transfer home.  
Originally Mum was due home the previous Friday a private ambulance was ordered, as they would have been able to hoist Mum into her chair. But she took not well and discharge was delayed.  
Yesterday, the patient transfer were told the wrong time when the carers would be here, so on arrival, and after accessing the layout of our hall and livingroom, they had to transfer Mum from the trolley into a wheelchair, using a sheet from the Ward. Mum has complexed mobility so this was really hurt her. Once in the house, I was asked where the carers were, advised the time they were here, so I was asked if I could use the hoist!!! I said no as it would not be safe and due to my bad back I would never put Mum at risk.  
So once again, they transferred Mum by this sheet, with the wheelchair at the corner of the chair, not safe and they could have dropped Mum!!!  
  
We have used patient transport many a time, and they have always been fantastic, but this time it was a horrible experience for my Mum!

readBy.name: Scottish Ambulance Service

author: Katee95
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Fall at home
body: I had a fall at home and came into hospital at 9.00 this morning. I have fractured my wrist and am just awaiting an operation to set the broken bone as it was quite a severe break. So far, I have no complaints whatsoever- the staff so far have been really lovely and very reassuring. The ward is immaculate from what I gather, which is no surprise as the cleaners are busy the entire day. As I have been fasting for my upcoming operation, I haven’t been given a proper meal. Overall, I am happy with the care that I have received in the past 24 hours.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Dde79
authorRole: the patient
title: Journey of breast screening
body:
I would just like to say thank you to all the staff that took care of me in the breast screening unit in Altnagelvin Hospital derry who from the moment I walked in were so helpful and kind. The service was so efficient even though I was nervous and didn't know the process.  
Everything was explained so clearly and they do everything there that day so that you don't have to leave and come back.  
Thank you, a wonderful service.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: couragebe68
authorRole: a service user
title: AAA Screening
body:
Excellent service from the staff at the Bradbury Clinic this afternoon  
Well done!

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Tersg66
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I’m getting the best care in daisy hill.
body:
I came up to ED last Thursday. I had quite a long wait in ED before getting seen, but I didn’t have long to wait till I got a bed. I then spent the night in DAU. I then came up to female surgical on Friday evening when a bed became available. Everything has been very good. It’s all going very smoothly, the way it should be.  
The nurses are lovely. They can’t do enough for you. They are all great. They work very hard, although they are all under a lot of pressure.  
The doctors are in every day checking on me. My only gripe is that one doctor was telling me one thing and different doctor was telling me another. I was told I would be here 5-7 days, then another doctor told me I would be here for 14 days. They aren’t singing off the same hymn sheet. You just want consistency. But they are doing their best.  
The food isn’t great. The breakfast and desserts are nice.  
The ward is good and clean. The cleaning staff are in a few times a day. They are meticulous.  
I’m getting the best care in daisy hill.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Tersg66
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I’m very satisfied with every stay I’ve had in Daisy Hill.
body:
I have been in female surgical since Sunday. I was in hospital 5 times last year and 2 times this year. Female surgical has been great. The nurses and staff are very good. They are looking after me so well.  
I see the doctors every day. They are keeping me well informed on all their plans of action.  
The ward is good, but it is a bit crammed. This ward is only supposed to hold 4 beds. The turnover of patients is very quick. It’s a very busy ward.  
The staff are very nice.  
The food is good, although I don’t have much of an appetite but you definitely get plenty of food.  
There really is nothing to criticise. I’m very satisfied with every stay I’ve had in Daisy Hill.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: learningmm75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The hospital staff are doing the best they can.
body:
I came in last Monday to ED. I was then moved up to female medical, before being moved in to coronary care.  
It’s only until you’re a patient you realise the amount of bad manners patients give staff. It’s absolutely ridiculous.  
Everyone in coronary care are excellent. I am being so well looked after. The doctors are very good and are being very thorough.  
The food is actually quite good. Great choice on the menu, but it’s no home cooked meal.  
The ward is spotless, the cleaning staff are in a good few times a day, and are in thoroughly cleaning down the beds as soon as a patient leaves.  
My only issue would be the waiting times. I have to wait till next week to go to Craigavon for an ECG. I know its Easter weekend and it can’t be helped but it’s a long wait.  
The hospital staff are doing the best they can.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Its very clean and has a nice calming environment
body:
I have had a few visits to the clinic in the past 2 years. The staff have always been so welcoming.  
This service is run well, I have always been able to get appointments that suit and I couldn't think of any improvements for the service.  
The clinic is laid out well, its very clean and has a nice calming environment.  
The staff have always tried there best with me and have been great listeners.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Cath56
authorRole: the patient
title: Endoscopy Unit - Appointments
body: I had been referred initially for an appointment for a Colonoscopy which I was extremely nervous about.  On entering Endoscopy Unit at Ninewells Hospital, Dundee I was seen within minutes and prepared for my procedure.  The nurse was excellent and explained all that would happen, immediately putting me at ease.  I chose to have the sedation and can honestly say I didn't feel anything except a little bit of stomach cramp where they have to manouver the camera inside stomach and I even watched it all on the screen.  I didn't feel at all embarrassed and the staff were excellent.  I think the procedure was approximately 20 mins but I felt it was over within minutes.  When finished the endoscopist explains his findings then I was given a printout of all that had been found and he referred me to have a Gastroscope.  The receptionist called me the very next day to arrange the Gastroscope and I was seen 2 weeks later.  Very efficient, caring staff making an uncomfortable procedure as quick and pain free as possible.

readBy.name: NHS Tayside

author: rt_0901
authorRole: the patient
title: 20 week scan at Aberdeen Maternity Hospital
body:
We had our 20 week scan at Aberdeen Maternity hospital yesterday. I was anxious as I had a miscarriage last year and had been worried that we would get bad news but we left with big smiles on our faces, thanks to our lovely sonographers.  
Rachel was our main sonographer, however Stacey did most of the scanning as she is training to be an Obstetrician. They both put us at ease straight away, they were so lovely and chatty.  
As Stacey was training, we got some really great detail of the baby, what she and Rachel were looking for and what measurements they were taking. The whole appointment was so fascinating and we got some brilliant views of our wee one. Stacey did such a great job and I felt that Rachel was brilliant at guiding and supporting Stacey at times when she was unsure.  
We couldn't thank them enough as we were leaving and hope our feedback is passed on to them as they really made such a big difference to our day.

readBy.name: NHS Grampian
Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership

author: aoiy23
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The cleanliness of the ward is also very good
body: I have been enjoy my stay here on the ramone 1 ward the staff have been very kind, I came down to this ward last week after having surgery. The staff have been providing the best care and support towards me. There an physiotherapist Aimee who comes to me and is great at what she does. She has been working very hard with me and I have seen major improvements. The food has been grand I feel like its your standard hospital food which is okay. The cleanliness of the ward is also very good the cleaners are very kind every time they come into the room they always chat to me.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Brilliant nurses
body:
The Mandeville is a great unit, I've been coming here for a couple of years.  
The nurses are brilliant and I've never had a problem with anything.  
I think the food is lovely and the cleanliness is lovely too.  
I have no complaints about the unit and I don't think many will as its great and were getting the best care out there!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: microscopiumce87
authorRole: the patient
title: We would be absolutely lost without this hospital.
body:
I have been on coronary care since Wednesday. The staff are absolutely brilliant. I have been coming to Daisy Hill all my life, I had my kids here. I would say Daisy Hill is an amazing hospital and we would be absolutely lost without this hospital.  
Coronary care has been brilliant. The ward is very clean and the food is good, so I really can’t complain.  
The only thing I would highlight would be the pressure the staff are under. They need more staff.  
But all the staff in coronary care, no matter how busy they are always make sure their patients are well looked after.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I think the girls have a great set up in the unit
body:
The nurses have a heart of gold. They are all just fabulous.  
I don't usually eat the food when I am in, I just have a cup of tea or coffee and bring my own wee snacks in with me.  
The facilities are all good and I think the girls have a great set up in the unit.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: decemberbe65
authorRole: the patient
title: I am happy with all the care I am getting on coronary care
body:
I was in coronary care in February for a week and now I am back again in April.  
My stays in Daisy Hill are always very good. The staff are excellent. The doctors are very nice. Sometimes I don’t understand what the doctors mean but the nurses are very good at elaborating and explaining things more clearly for me. The doctors are round every day to see me.  
The ward is brilliant, it’s clean and it’s warm.  
The food is very good. I am getting well fed.  
I am happy with all the care I am getting on coronary care. I couldn’t say a bad word about this hospital.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: cepheusnn88
authorRole: the patient
title: I really could not fault one thing during this experience
body:
I had my daughter in March in Craigavon area hospital. She was 9 weeks premature. We then spent 3 weeks in the neonatal unit in Craigavon. We have since been moved up to SCBU in Daisy Hill Hospital. Everything in SCBU has been lovely. The girls are all so good up here. They really are so helpful. My daughter is being so well cared for, as am I. They are very good to me also. We are being spoilt. They are so good reassuring me and keeping me well informed of everything.  
The ward is very clean.  
I really could not fault one thing during this experience. We just can’t wait to get our little girl home.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Natbs79
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Both the ward and the staff have been terrific
body:
Both the Female Surgical Ward and the staff on it have been terrific - every single one of them. They are all very good and explain everything to me well. They always have a really lovely attitude. I would like to particularly mention Catrina who has been absolutely superb - I would take her home with me if I could. There was a male nurse on last night who was also really lovely.  
The food has all been excellent - the porridge today in particular has been outstanding. I have been quite comfortable on Female Surgical.  
I only have one complaint about my stay here and that is that yesterday the bathroom had three containers of urine left in it all day which I thought was totally irresponsible.  
Other than this everything has been perfect and I am very happy with the care I have received.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Maternity staff are so great at being understanding
body:
Maternity has been a place I thought I would have dreaded yet, it has exceeded my expectations. The care I have been receiving is great, I could not ask for any better. The ward itself is very clean and tidy, which is good considering it has new born babies on it.  
The staff are just something you cannot describe, like really. They are amazing I cannot compliment them enough. They helped me when I need it and explain everything to me since I am a first time mum.  
Maternity staff are so great at being understanding.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I have been in the best hands in the stroke ward
body:
Stroke has been a decent ward, I cannot comment on much as I have not been well enough to take a lot in. Although, I do feel myself getting better so I know I am in a good place.  
The staff are so good to me. Their friendliness makes it ten times easier to be here. I try not to bother them as little ass possible but they are there if you need them.  
I have been in the best hands in the stroke ward.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Every single staff member is amazing
body:
Paediatric Ambulatory Ward (PAW) was great. It was just a check up for my daughter since she is a month old. She was slightly jaundice when she was born and the staff were great at dealing with it, and explaining everything to me.  
The PAW appointment was really quick and they got all the tests done that they needed to, I know my daughter was crying but the tests are necessary.  
The staff are amazing here. They are great at what they do and know everything. They are the best, I do not know how to describe them.  
Every single staff member is amazing.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Have been no complaints from me
body: The care that I have been getting in Loane house has been great so far there really have been no complaints from me. The staff that the hospital has are all just excellent rally not a single bad word i could say about any of them. There all very nice, kind and take the time to communicate with me so that i understand as i am a little hard of hearing. Foods been alright so far really enjoy it. Haven't a problem with my care so far

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: February2023
authorRole: a service user
title: Maternity 2023 (vs 2020)
body:
I gave birth to my son earlier this year, but due to the new-born juggling act, it's taken me until now to send in feedback about my experience of the maternity unit at QEUH.  
Essentially, I wanted to write in with praise of and thanks to the staff who supported and provided care to my son and I. I was induced due to late stage pregnancy health complications, followed by a midwife led birth. Throughout the process the midwives were fantastic - present, helpful, clear in their communication, caring (I find this difficult to quantify but very important), and efficient with interventions when needed (while still checking my consent and comprehension at significant moments), all during, what seemed like, a very busy shift.  
This may have been business as usual for them, but in contrast to my experiences delivering my other child in 2020, this was a marked improvement. During my previous experience, I was extremely isolated, did not have visual access needs respected, was not given access to painkillers for most of labour, and was not given access to food for 36 hours (of which only the first 14 were spent in labour). I know the hospital addressed some of the issues with my first birth following feedback, but I wanted to note how much of a difference having support throughout from staff made this time around better. In particular I wanted to note the attentiveness and care of the student midwives who were working on the labour and maternity wards, and of their supervising lead midwives. They especially gave a calm and supportive response when the crash cord needed pulled and my son was born unresponsive and with the cord around him. He's fine now, but it was terrifying in the moment and they were wonderful - calm, efficient, and caring.  
I have since had none of the problems with severe postnatal anxiety or depression I had following my other child's birth, and I attribute this largely to a positive and supported (if - let's not get too rose tinted - still very painful) birth experience. So - thank you, to the team at QEUH.

readBy.name: NHS Greater Glasgow & Clyde

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: i am very happy with the care
body: I am very happy with the care that i have been getting as its been absolutely excellent so far. The staff have been the best part of my care with every single one of the staff members whether it be day or night they have all been absolutely brilliant and so kind. They do a brilliant job anytime they explain anything and have honestly been great. The foods been brilliant and i really enjoy the variety. I haven't a problem with the care really not an issue so far.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Very easy to understand and their communication is great.
body:
I have been treated excellent since I came into the hospital.  
The reason I think that the care has been excellent so far is the brilliant staff that I have looking after me. They are always more than friendly with me and seeing them everyday shows how pleasant they all are. They do a brilliant job and so far have been very easy to understand and their communication is great.  
The foods really quite good however the portions are always a lot bigger than what I need.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The stroke ward has a great team running it
body:
The stroke ward has been good so far. I have been here a while recovering from a stroke I had. It has been peaceful and relaxed and I am definitely improving. The food is good and I like the company of the other patients. I am so glad though that we can have visitors it makes the day pass quicker.  
The staff are so good, everything runs smoothly. I like how efficient they are and have things going. They have a routine and I like having a routine also.  
The stroke ward has a great team running it.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: aoiy23
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: cleanliness has been very good
body: At the moment I have been suffering with long term covid symptoms which hasn't been the nicest thing to have. I still find it very hard to breathe and my taste is still not the same. I have had to come onto the 2 North Ward due to my breathing getting a lot worse recently. Staff have been very supportive and reassuring, I feel that I am in good care as they are all brilliant at what they do and nothing is ever too much trouble for them to do. The food is very nice I have been enjoying the chicken curry and the ice cream and the cleanliness has been very good

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Patient and Client Council
Public Health Agency
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Male surgical has a bit of craic about it
body:
Male surgical is okay. I do like the craic of the other patients but I miss talking face to face with my family. The facetime calls are good but it is not the same. The ward although is covid run it is clean and everything is being disinfected.  
The staff are what keep you half sane. They tell you what is going on outside, news wise. They also are all a bit of fun and keep us entertained.  
Male surgical has a bit of craic about it.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Male surgical staff are a great support when you cannot see anyone
body:
Male surgical has been a good ward. I feel better but still cannot get out since the ward is red. The ward is clean and hygienic. The other patients keep you entertained and they make the day pass by faster since we are not allowed visitors.  
The staff are great and really do their best for everyone. They try to keep everyone in good form.  
Male surgical staff are a great support when you can't see anyone.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Ridiculous wait time
body: Visited the ‘urgent’ treatment centre today with my 4 month old to be left 3 hours before being triaged and then another hour until she was seen by a doctor. Absolutely shocking amount of time to leave a 4 month old baby, I informed them that I had only brought one bottle with me, one of the nurses went looking for some milk for me but never came back. I couldn’t fault the doctor we saw he was brilliant but that is the only good thing I can say about this department. People who came in after my daughter were being seen first, which is wrong.

author: Natbs79
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I couldn't praise staff high enough
body:
My time on Daisy Hill's Female Surgical Ward has been absolutely amazing. The staff are all excellent - no matter what you want they are there for you. They also have great teamwork and work so well together. They really are 10/10 - very very good. The staff also ensure to explain everything that is going on - I really could not praise them high enough. I would particularly like to mention both Helena and Christina who have been absolutely great.  
The ward is also kept spotless - they are always changing the bedsheets. The toilets have also been kept spotless. The food has been lovely - especially the porridge this morning.  
There are no improvements I can think of - there are no problems from where I am sitting.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Natbs79
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff have been really good to me
body: It has been great on Female Surgical. The staff have all been really lovely - they have all been very good to me. They always make sure I know what is going on with regards to my care and always approach their work with a very nice attitude. I couldn't name anybody in particular as they have all been lovely to me. The ward has been both clean and comfortable enough to me. It really has been like a home from home. The food has all been very nice. I have no suggestions for improvement - everything has been up to standard.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: A Big Thank You
body: I was admitted to A & E on 4th April with extreme head pain, was seen within 2 hours, thoroughly checked including brain scan and asked to attend Same Day Emergency Services on 6th April.  There I found a haven of quiet efficiency, was again seen within 2 hours and treated at all times with courtesy.  Free tea, coffee and biscuits were welcome too.  After ruling out some serious possibilities, I was allowed to go home with strong painkillers and a recommendation for physiotherapy, which I have already arranged.  I am very grateful to Barnsley Hospital for the smiling staff and their efficient way of dealing with poorly people!

readBy.name: Barnsley Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

author: Natbs79
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: No complaints about Coronary Care
body:
It has been absolutely grand on Coronary Care. The staff have all been fine - I have absolutely no complaints whatsoever. The staff are great at communicating with me and explaining everything that is going on. They also have a very good attitude. I couldn't name anyone over the other as they have all been so good.  
The ward itself has been clean and very comfortable. All the bathrooms have been kept spotless as well. The only thing I could think that needs improving is that when you transfer between wards you don't get the food that you had originally ordered and you end up getting something you don't really want to eat - it would be good if the menu order could travel with you.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Natbs79
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: So far it has been 100% on Female Medical
body:
So far it has been 100% on Female Medical - it has been very very good. I really could not say anything bad about Daisy Hill. The staff have all been fantastic - both very friendly and very nice. They take their time explaining things to me and are always up for a good bit of craic which is very important as well.  
Maura in particular has always been very friendly. However, everyone has been amazing. If you ever need anything at all they will go and get it for you. The ward has been kept spotless and has been very comfy. When it comes to the food, breakfast in particular has been lovely and Maura always makes some good toast! I have no suggestions for improvement.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Natbs79
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: It has been outstanding on Female Medical
body:
Female Medical has been outstanding so far. The staff really have been phenomenal - really excellent. All the explanations from staff have been perfect and all the staff are very understanding in their approach. The ward has been clean and comfortable and my breakfast this morning was perfect.  
The only issue I have had was in A&E - the waiting times really need improving. I had to wait over 15 hours. However, all the nurses and doctors were all lovely and really very excellent.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Natbs79
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff have been lovely
body: My time on Female Medical has been so far so good. The staff have all been incredibly lovely and they make sure to take the time to let you know everything that is going on. The ward has been kept incredibly clean by the domestic staff and I have been very comfortable here - it really couldn't be better. The food has all been alright - it does the job. I have no suggestions for improvement.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Cland93
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Respiratory Ward
body:
I have been in hospital for just over a month, The Royal for four weeks and I was transferred back to Daisy Hill Hospital as I need carer's and they are very hard to get. I had my toes amputated due to Diabetes and now I have Covid, I think I got Covid as I seen visitors walking around the ward with no mask on.  
The nurses are really nice and friendly, they look after me very well, I find the food just ok it could be better. I really want to get home it has been a long time since I seen my family.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Natbs79
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I couldn't speak highly enough about the staff
body:
Everyone is so very very kind on the Female Medical Ward - I really couldn't speak highly enough about the staff. I have a hearing aid and I have to say the staff have all taken their time to make sure I understand everything and if I have any questions they make sure to answer them. They also explain things to my relative which I find also helps in case I miss something.  
The staff have all got a wonderful attitude and they are so helpful. All the nurses have been great - I couldn't name anyone in particular over the next as everyone who comes round is very good. All the doctors have been excellent as well.  
I have been kept very comfortable on the ward and everything has been kept spotless. The food has been fine - I don't really have much of an appetite at the minute but it has been adequate. I think a few salads on the menu would be good.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
